title: [BUG][DOC] API reference on `sktime.utils` module is wrong, outdated, confusing
body:
@fkiraly update after discussion below (Apr 22):

The API reference page on the `sktime.utils` module is incorrect:
https://www.sktime.org/en/stable/api_reference/utils.html

Most of the functions aren't even there anymore.
This needs to be updated, preferably urgently.

What should be in the utilities section:

* `sktime.datatypes` functionality `convert`, `convert_to`, `check_is`, `check_raise` for "data processing"
* plotting, that's still in the `utils` module
* `check_estimator` for manual testing
* maybe some of the synthetic data generators, `_make_series`, `_make_panel`, `_make_hierarchical` (in `utils`) and `get_examples` (in `datatypes`)

Sources for this page are in `docs/source/api_reference/utils`


---

**Describe the bug**
I'm looking to work with sktime, but I can't seem to import any of the functions provided in the _utils_ module. 

**To Reproduce**
I created a brand new venv with sktime version 0.11.2. 
1. python3 venv 
2. pip install sktime

There were no issues the popped up during installation. 

**Environment**
Linux pop-os 5.13.0-7620-generic Ubuntu  x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

When I go to import sktime.utils.from_nested_to_2d_array, I receive the following error: 
AttributeError: module 'sktime.utils' has no attribute 'from_nested_to_2d_array'. 

When I look at what attributes the module has, I get the following: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/83707037/164559890-a848e6ac-668d-4d12-9c46-d444da2089bc.png)

I'm looking to test an implementation of ROCKET using the sktime library, but I have been unsuccessful due to these module errors. Am I doing something incorrect?
